Use: Whitefly has used a simple remote shell tool that will call back to the C2 server and wait for commands. [1]
Whitefly has used an open-source tool to exploit a known Windows privilege escalation vulnerability (CVE-2016-0051) on unpatched computers. [1]

Technique: Hijack Execution Flow: DLL Search Order Hijacking
Use: Whitefly has used search order hijacking to run the loader Vcrodat. [1]
Whitefly has the ability to download additional tools from the C2. [1]

Technique: Masquerading: Match Legitimate Name or Location
Use: Whitefly has named the malicious DLL the same name as DLLs belonging to legitimate software from various security vendors. [1]

Technique: Obfuscated Files or Information: Encrypted/Encoded File
Use: Whitefly has encrypted the payload used for C2. [1]
Whitefly has obtained and used tools such as Mimikatz . [1]
Whitefly has used Mimikatz to obtain credentials. [1]
Whitefly has used malicious .exe or .dll files disguised as documents or images. [1]
